data.title: OK
data.text: The food is just like any other CiCis pizza. The restaurant is averagely clean and the pizza is decent.

data.title: Management very rude
data.text: My family and I decided to go to Cici's Pizza to eat and visit with family since we are from out of town. To start off my wife is a quadriplegic and we have a chocolate lab service dog to assist her with doors and picking up items. As we entered the restaurant the manager told us they do not allow dogs inside the building. She was wearing her service vest, but I still informed him that she is a service dog for my wife. The manager again told us she was still not allowed inside the restaurant. He then asked what my wife's disability was and why we needed to have the dog inside the restaurant with us. My wife told him its non of his business and she was not required to tell him. We did inform him it is against federal regulations to ask what her disability was and why the dog needed to be there. After informing him of that he did appologize and allowed us in, at which point we then felt uncomfortable dining in there. Other then that, the pizza was fresh and tasted good.

data.title: Great family pizza
data.text: Excellent service. Friendly staff. Always willing to make any custom pizza /dish you ask for. They work hard to keep the buffet well stocked with a good variety of pizzas.

data.title: Friendly staff
data.text: This is one of the best locations for cici's I've ever been to! The staff was terrific with my large group. The food was fresh and there was a large selection on the salad bar.

data.title: Mediocre
data.text:
Let's face it. Cici's pizza is not good. But that's not why one goes. One goes because it is a cheap, all-you-can-eat buffet, and the kids don't know it's not good. 

I tend to stick to the breadsticks and salad and desert pizza, which are also mediocre, but a step up from the pizza. My kids, on the other hand, eat more than enough to make a trip worthwhile.  

The service hasn't been great at this location. Once I had a coupon for a free buffet and after much puzzlement, the cashier rung me up for all three buffets anyway. It was too much trouble to get her to correct it. Once there was no silverware available and I had to wait a good six minutes before it came out. 

A small game room at the back will give you a chance to throw away some more money, so don't bring change or bills.

data.title: Below Par
data.text: I usually go to the CiCi's in Lewisville, but we had a groupon for this one, and it was close to where we were going shopping. Unless you order a pizza, you were mostly out of luck. There were hardly any pizzas on the buffet; and when there were, customers would get up and grab them quickly so it was back to nothing. There were small children in the kitchen area which really bothered me as well. I think they were hoping that people would just get up and leave so they wouldn't have to make any more pizzas.

data.title: Only go here if you want lots of cheap pizza
data.text: The quality of this pizza is not good but it's cheap and it's all you can eat.  The dessert pizza is ok.  There also isn't much of any type of atmosphere. Lots of better places to eat.

data.title: Quality has decreased while prices increase :-/
data.text: I realize prices have to change with our ever changing world, e.g. fuel, cost of food, etc.  But how about easing us into it?  For years, CiCi's niche was the $2.99 buffet and it was pretty darn tasty!  Heck, you could add a coke for a buck and even after tax you could hand over a 5-spot and get back change!  Sadly, that $5 bill no longer covers the buffet...and the pizza is just awful.  Not to mention the pasta that always seems to look like it's been out since 4 days before.  For $10 I'd much rather grab Pizza Hut to-go!

data.title: Yummy pizza, Helpful staff
data.text:
This CiCis is always working hard to make sure we are happy!  Lots of fresh choices on the buffet line, and they will custom make any pizza you want and deliver it to your table.  You can have one slice, or the whole pie!  

The salad bar is limited but fresh, and the pasta bar has a few good choices.  They brought back plain cooked noodles at the request of patrons.  Love customer service like that!

There are always coupons available if you join their rewards club.  Definitely worth doing.  Parking is easy to come by & store is always clean.
